main event: On April 6, 1967, Mr. Jack Bailie and Mr. Joseph Waskiewicz observed a bright red light in the sky south of Newburgh, New York.
interesting points: The light moved slowly and erratically for about 5 minutes before disappearing., The witnesses reported the sighting to the local police, who notified the FAA and the Air Force., An Air Force investigator concluded the sighting was likely a weather balloon, but witnesses disagreed., The object was described as round, about 100 feet in diameter, and bright white., The behavior of the object included rapid movement, sudden stops, and 90-degree turns.
sighted object: a bright red light in the sky
witness description: Mr. Jack Bailie and Mr. Joseph Waskiewicz, both residents of Newburgh
